data.event: Lake County was founded on February 20, 1855, as Superior County, though its name was changed on March 3, of that year to Saint Louis County.
Lake County was founded on February 20, 1855, as Superior County, though its name was changed on March 3, of that year to Saint Louis County.
On March 1, 1856, Saint Louis County became Lake County, while Newton County to the west was renamed Saint Louis County.
In 1868, iron ore was discovered on the Vermilion Range by George Stuntz.

event.title: 1884, the first shipment of ore left

data.event: In 1884, the first shipment of ore left Agate Bay, marking Minnesota's entry into the iron ore industry.
In 1890, the Merritt brothers discovered the Mesabi Range.

event.title: was built on Agate Bay in 1892

data.event: The Two Harbors Lighthouse was built on Agate Bay in 1892.

event.title: Ten years later, five Two Harbors businessmen signed

data.event: Ten years later, five Two Harbors businessmen signed the articles of incorporation for a new mining company named 3M.

event.title: Today, 3M Corporation has over 70,000 employees worldwide and produces

data.event: Today, 3M Corporation has over 70,000 employees worldwide and produces more than 50,000 adhesive household products, now has its headquarters in Saint Paul.
